intro: Merostachys calderoniana, commonly known as the Calderón's grass, is a rare and endemic plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, spikelet-based inflorescences. It thrives in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and nutrient-poor soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
